briefdescription.para: Constants for SI units and physical constants.
SIUnit represents the unit of a physical quantity.

detaileddescription.para:
An important characteristic of physical quantities is that any given physical quantity can be derived from other physical quantities through physical laws. For example, the physical quantity of speed is calculated as a ratio of distance traveled to time elapsed. The volume of a box is calculated as the product of three quantities of length: i.e., height, width, and depth of the box. Any physical quantity can always be related back through physical laws to a smaller set of reference physical quantities. In fact, as the laws of physics become unified it has been argued that this smaller set can be reduced to simply the Planck length and the speed of light. At the level of theory employed by most scientists and engineers, however, there is a practical agreement that seven physical quantities should serve as fundamental reference quantities from which all other physical quantities can be derived. These reference quantities are:
length
mass
time
electric current
thermodynamic temperature (the absolute measure of temperature)
amount of substance
luminous intensity

briefdescription.para: Type of a reference to immutable SIUnit.
Gets the type ID of SIUnit.
Gets unit's dimensionality.
Gets unit's numerator root unit prefix for the dimension at index.

detaileddescription.para:
theUnit
The unit.
index
The index of the dimension.
The integer exponent associated with an SI prefix.
Root unit for length, mass, time, current, temperature, amount, and luminous intensity are assigned to index constants kSILengthIndex, kSIMassIndex, kSITimeIndex, kSICurrentIndex, kSITemperatureIndex, kSIAmountIndex, kSILuminousIntensityIndex, respectively.

briefdescription.para: Gets unit's denominator root unit prefix for the dimension at index.

detaileddescription.para:
theUnit
The unit.
index
The index of the dimension.
The integer exponent associated with an SI prefix.
Root unit for length, mass, time, current, temperature, amount, and luminous intensity are assigned to index constants kSILengthIndex, kSIMassIndex, kSITimeIndex, kSICurrentIndex, kSITemperatureIndex, kSIAmountIndex, kSILuminousIntensityIndex, respectively.

simplesect.para: String containing the plural base name, or NULL.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether root symbol is a special SI unit symbol.
Determines if unit is one of the seven coherent base units.
Determines if unit is one of the seven base root units.
Determines if unit is one of the prefixed seven base units.
Determines if unit is one of the SI coherent derived units.
Determines if unit is the dimensionless and underived unit.
Determines if unit is the dimensionless unit.
Determines if units are equivalent.

detaileddescription.para:
theUnit1
The first unit.
theUnit2
The second unit.
True or false.
Determines if units are equivalent. If true, these two units can be substituted for each other without modifying the quantity's numerical value.

briefdescription.para: Determines if the two units are equal.
Returns the dimensionless and underived unit.
Creates an array of units that are equivalent to a unit.
Finds the unit with the shortest symbol.

simplesect.para: The unit with the shortest symbol.

briefdescription.para: Creates an array of units for a quantity.
Creates an array of units for a dimensionality.
Creates an array of units having same reduced dimensionality.
Creates an array of units that have same dimensionality as unit.
Gets the scaling from the Non-SI root unit to coherent derived SI unit with the same dimensionality.
Creates a OCStringRef with the name of unit from its root_name and prefix.
Creates a OCStringRef with the plural name of unit from its plural root name and prefix.

simplesect.para: A OCStringRef with the plural name.

briefdescription.para: Gets the OCStringRef with the Symbol of unit from its root symbol and prefix.
Calculates the scaling factor needed to transform the numerical value of quantity with this unit into the appropriate numerical value for the coherent si unit of the same dimensionality.
Creates a OCStringRef with the unit's derived symbol.

simplesect.para: A OCStringRef with the derived unit symbol.

briefdescription.para: Returns a coherent SI unit with given dimensionality.
Returns a coherent SI unit with the dimensionality of input unit.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a double float variable for the unit_multiplier. This unit_multiplier will be scaled to make the new quantity's numerical value consistent with the new unit. Thus, the initial value for the unit_multiplier should be non-zero.

briefdescription.para: Returns the unit by dividing the numerator and denominator exponents by an integer.

detaileddescription.para:
input
The unit.
root
The integer root.
unit_multiplier
Pointer to a double float variable for the unit_multiplier. This unit_multiplier will be scaled to make the new quantity's numerical value consistent with the new unit. Thus, the initial value for the unit_multiplier should be non-zero.
error
An OCString describing the error.
The nth root unit.
The numerator and denominator exponents in a valid unit can only take on integer values. If this function cannot return a valid unit then it will return NULL.

briefdescription.para: Returns the unit by reducing the numerator and denominator exponents to their lowest integer values.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a double float variable for the unit_multiplier. This unit_multiplier will be scaled to make the new quantity's numerical value consistent with the new unit. Thus, the initial value for the unit_multiplier should be non-zero.

briefdescription.para: Returns the unit obtained by multiplying two units and reducing the dimensionality numerator and denominator exponents to their lowest integer values.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a double float variable for the unit_multiplier. This unit_multiplier will be scaled to make the new quantity's numerical value consistent with the new unit. Thus, the initial value for the unit_multiplier should be non-zero.

briefdescription.para: Returns the unit obtained by dividing two units and reducing the dimensionality numerator and denominator exponents to their lowest integer values.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a double float variable for the unit_multiplier. This unit_multiplier will be scaled to make the new quantity's numerical value consistent with the new unit. Thus, the initial value for the unit_multiplier should be non-zero.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a double float variable for the unit_multiplier. This unit_multiplier will be scaled to make the new quantity's numerical value consistent with the new unit. Thus, the initial value for the unit_multiplier should be non-zero.

briefdescription.para: Returns the unit obtained by raising a unit to a power and reducing the dimensionality numerator and denominator exponents to their lowest integer values.

parameterdescription.para: The power to raise the unit to.

Pointer to a double float variable for the unit_multiplier. This unit_multiplier will be scaled to make the new quantity's numerical value consistent with the new unit. Thus, the initial value for the unit_multiplier should be non-zero.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a double float variable for the unit_multiplier. This unit_multiplier will be scaled to make the new quantity's numerical value consistent with the new unit. Thus, the initial value for the unit_multiplier should be non-zero.

simplesect.para: The unit or NULL if unit with derived symbol is not valid.

briefdescription.para: Create an array of units for quantity, if valid.

simplesect.para: An array of units or NULL if no units for quantity are found.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the conversion factor between units of the same dimensionality.
Shows a short descriptor of the unit.
Shows a long descriptor of the unit.
Returns a boolean indicating if library uses imperial volumes for gallon, quart, pint, fluid ounce, tablespoon, and teaspoon.

detaileddescription.para:
The boolean result.
If true, the US unit symbols are appended with 'US', i.e. galUS, qtUS, ptUS, etc... If false, the imperial symbols are appended with 'UK', i.e. galUK, qtUK, ptUK, etc...

briefdescription.para: Sets the library to use imperial volumes for gallon, quart, pint, fluid ounce, tablespoon, and teaspoon.

detaileddescription.para:
value
Boolean value indicating whether to use imperial volumes.
If true, the US unit symbols are appended with 'US', i.e. galUS, qtUS, ptUS, etc... If false, the imperial symbols are appended with 'UK', i.e. galUK, qtUK, ptUK, etc...

Sets the library of units.

Shows a full description of every unit in the library.

briefdescription.para: Declares the SIUnit interface for representing and manipulating physical units.

detaileddescription.para: SIUnit provides an interface for SI and derived units, supporting unit construction, comparison, and conversion. The API is CoreFoundation-style, with explicit memory management and reference counting.
SIUnit objects are immutable by default; use SIMutableUnitRef for mutable variants.
This interface supports querying the symbol, dimensionality, and conversion factors of a unit, as well as unit arithmetic and comparison.
